node.title: Crossbencher agrees to support Victorian government's amended pandemic bill
node.alt: Daniel Andrews stands at a microphone outdoors in a shirt, jacket and blue tie wearing glasses.
node.description: The Victorian Government's contentious pandemic legislation looks set to pass parliament after a crossbencher agreed to support an amended version of the bill.
node.content:
["The Victorian government's contentious pandemic legislation looks set to pass parliament after a crossbencher agreed to support an amended version of the bill.", "Transport Matters MP Rod Barton will vote in favour of the legislation if six amendments are made.", "They include a new joint parliamentary committee to review public health orders and an independent panel to review appeals to detention under public health orders.", "A Victorian government spokeswoman\u00a0said the emergence of the Omicron variant highlighted that the pandemic was not over, and that Victoria needed the powers that all other jurisdictions across Australia had to keep our community safe.", "\"Over the past fortnight, we offered negotiations to the entire crossbench, giving them the opportunity to work with us on changes to this bill that would ensure Victoria has such a framework in place,\" she said.", "\"These were rigorous negotiations \u2014\u00a0and we thank Rod Barton, who came to the table in good faith.\"", "The proposed bill faced\u00a0defeat in the Upper House after former minister Adem Somyurek declared he would vote against it in its current form.\u00a0", "", "
Transport Matters party leader and Eastern Metropolitan Region MP\u00a0Rod Barton\u00a0has been\u00a0negotiating with the government.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "Designed to replace State of Emergency laws\u00a0used to bring in restrictions during the COVID-19 pandemic \u2014\u00a0powers that will expire next month \u2014 the proposed laws give the government the legal basis for lockdowns, mandatory mask-wearing, vaccine mandates and curfews.", "The Victorian government has said the new laws would be \"purpose-built\" for a pandemic response.", "Its proposed legislation has been the subject of intense debate, attracting protests outside the Victorian parliament for a number of weeks."]
